main event: Two pilots observed an unidentified object near Barter Island, Alaska on February 8, 1953.
interesting points: The object appeared to move in a falling leaf pattern,It hovered for approximately 15 minutes and emitted a sound similar to a helicopter,The object was estimated to be 30 to 40 feet in diameter and was sighted by two rated pilots,The object started moving rapidly after hovering, including a pulsing or fluttering ascent,The report was evaluated by Captain R. E. Barnes and Lieutenant Griffin, both experienced pilots.
witness description: Rated pilots, Captain Barnes and Lieutenant Griffin, experienced with a combined flying time of over 1,500 hours.
